results.title: Metformin Ameliorates Neuronal Necroptosis after Intracerebral Hemorrhage by Activating AMPK.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: In the present study, we found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, a first-line medication for the treatment of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@, can effectively inhibit @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal necroptosis@@@ after @DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@ICH@@@ by activating the @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ related pathway, thereby significantly improving neurological function scores and reducing @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@.

citations.NLM: Lin C, Yang K, Zhang G, Yu J. Metformin Ameliorates Neuronal Necroptosis after Intracerebral Hemorrhage by Activating AMPK. Curr Neurovasc Res. 2021;18(3):351-359. PMID: 34561980
citations.BibTeX: @article{34561980, title={Metformin Ameliorates Neuronal Necroptosis after Intracerebral Hemorrhage by Activating AMPK.}, author={Lin C and Yang K and Zhang G and Yu J}, journal={Curr Neurovasc Res}, volume={18}, number={3}, pages={351-359}}

results.title: Neuroprotective effects of metformin on traumatic brain injury in rats is associated with the AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (100 and 200 mg/kg doses) attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@, improved BBB and @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@vestibulomotor dysfunction@@@ compared to @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ or Vehicle groups (P < 0.001).

citations.NLM: Rahimi S, Ferdowsi A, Siahposht-Khachaki A. Neuroprotective effects of metformin on traumatic brain injury in rats is associated with the AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway. Metab Brain Dis. 2020 Oct;35(7):1135-1144. PMID: 32621159
citations.BibTeX: @article{32621159, title={Neuroprotective effects of metformin on traumatic brain injury in rats is associated with the AMP-activated protein kinase signaling pathway.}, author={Rahimi S and Ferdowsi A and Siahposht-Khachaki A}, journal={Metab Brain Dis}, volume={35}, number={7}, pages={1135-1144}}

results.title: Metformin Inhibits NLR Family Pyrin Domain Containing 3 (NLRP)-Relevant Neuroinflammation via an Adenosine-5'-Monophosphate-Activated Protein Kinase (AMPK)-Dependent Pathway to Alleviate Early Brain Injury After Subarachnoid Hemorrhage in Mice
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Administration Improved Short-Term Neurological Functions and Attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@Brain Edema@@@ at 24 h After @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@Subarachnoid Hemorrhage@@@

results.title: Downregulating Cdk5 reverses hippocampal neuron ferroptosis by regulating the AMP-activated protein kinase pathway and "M1" polarized microglia.
results.text_hl: The results showed that @CHEMICAL_Roscovitine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077546 @@@Ros@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ improved neurological functions, @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@, mitigated "M1" polarization of microglia, and inhibited neuronal ferroptosis.

citations.NLM: Liu N, Peng A, Peng B, Xia H, Zhang Z, Zhang D, Xu S, Xu H. Downregulating Cdk5 reverses hippocampal neuron ferroptosis by regulating the AMP-activated protein kinase pathway and "M1" polarized microglia. J Neuropathol Exp Neurol. 2025 Aug 19;():. PMID: 40829042

results.title: Metformin attenuates early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via AMPK-dependent mitophagy.
results.text_hl: The expression of mitophagic and apoptotic proteins were investigated by immunofluorescence and western blot. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ at 20 mg/kg improved neurological function and attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@ and the disruption of BBB permeability 24 h after @DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang Y, Zhang T, Li Y, Guo Y, Liu B, Tian Y, Wu P, Shi H. Metformin attenuates early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via AMPK-dependent mitophagy. Exp Neurol. 2022 Jul;353():114055. PMID: 35341746

results.title: Metformin Alleviates Delayed Hydrocephalus after Intraventricular Hemorrhage by Inhibiting Inflammation and Fibrosis.
results.text_hl: In the acute phase, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment exerted dose-dependent neuroprotective effects by reducing periependymal apoptosis and @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal degeneration@@@ and decreasing @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@.

citations.NLM: Cao Y, Liu C, Li G, Gao W, Tang H, Fan S, Tang X, Zhao L, Wang H, Peng A, You C, Tong A, Zhou L. Metformin Alleviates Delayed Hydrocephalus after Intraventricular Hemorrhage by Inhibiting Inflammation and Fibrosis. Transl Stroke Res. 2022 Jul 19;():. PMID: 35852765

results.title: Acute Administration of Metformin Protects Against Neuronal Apoptosis Induced by Cerebral Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury via Regulation of the AMPK/CREB/BDNF Pathway
results.text_hl: In addition, after the administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@cerebral edema@@@ improved remarkably (Figure 2D).

results.title: Long-term metformin therapy improves neurobehavioral functions and antioxidative activity after cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury in rats.
results.text_hl: Our results showed that administration of 200 mg/kg @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ reduced the percent of @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@ (84.00 +- 2.13) in comparison with the @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ animals (91.25 +- 2.25) (p < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Fatemi I, Saeed-Askari P, Hakimizadeh E, Kaeidi A, Esmaeil-Moghaddam S, Pak-Hashemi M, Allahtavakoli M. Long-term metformin therapy improves neurobehavioral functions and antioxidative activity after cerebral ischemia/reperfusion injury in rats. Brain Res Bull. 2020 Oct;163():65-71. PMID: 32693150
